results.brief_description: A series consisting of four episodes and presented by environmental experts. It covers the topics: acid rain, air pollution, desertification, deforestation and food production.

results.title: Battle for the land. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Ian McFarlane, Chris Bryer and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
These episodes in the “Politics of Food” series examine poverty and hunger in Brazil. Brazil is one of the world leaders in food exports yet 1 in 8 children in poor areas will die from malnutrition. Much of the land which could be used to produce food crops is given over to high yield export crops such as sugar and cocoa. With little land to grow food many of the rural population have migrated to the cities where urban poverty is rife. As a consequence, corruption and violence are evident as the battle between wealthy landowners and the impoverished continues.

results.title: Battle for the Bulge
results.brief_description: Uses location filming and historical footage to document the ‘Battle for the Bulge’, the last big German offensive in World War II. Portrays the heroism, as well as the confusion and humiliation, that characterised both the Allied and German troops.

results.title: Batman's village
results.creator_credit: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia
results.brief_description: A picturesque view of Melbourne city interspersed with factual information on its history and the key figures involved in its establishment. Inner city streets, buildings and botanical gardens are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia

results.title: Batik
results.brief_description: A history of the Indian and Indonesian art and a demonstration by Nancy Belfer. Shows modern and traditional pieces being made. We see washing, drying and framing the cloth, the initial blocking-in of shapes, working with heated wax, the tjanting tool and the tjap, with a sequence on the actual printing and dyeing of the cloth. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Bathtime
results.creator_credit: Peter Madden, David Atkinson, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A humourous claymation where a woman after waking in the morning takes a bath going through her morning cleansing ritual before work. The partner only later wakes up to find the woman missing.

results.title: Bathing the patient (home care)
results.creator_credit: Marian Evans, F.E. Brooker, Ted Nemeth Studios and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description: A guide to the home care of that maimed and injured loved one, recently returned from that dust-up in the Pacific. Solemn tone betrays not the least sympathy for the invalided one. In the absence of emotion, the domestic environment becomes a place of chilling austerity. Dutiful wife seeming resigned to her fate as resentful attendant. Frightening for its utilitarian ommissions. United States Office of Education training film for use in the instruction of professional nurses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marian Evans, F.E. Brooker, Ted Nemeth Studios and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids

results.title: Bass on titles
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films and Saul Bass Films
results.brief_description: This film features American film producer Saul Bass discussing the evolution of title sequences that he has designed for feature films. He demonstrates how he translates the themes of major motion pictures into graphic visual animation. Sequences from films include: ‘The Man with the golden arm’, ‘West side story’, ‘It’s a mad, mad, mad world’ and ‘Walk on the wild side’, among others. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The University of Cincinnati basketball team demonstrate the fundamentals of dribbling, passing, shooting, body handling and defensive play. Practice and drill on each skill can produce expert players. No other credits available.
